item.title: Commercial bins overflowing with additional bags strewn across the pavement, 24th August
item.description:
Commercial bins overflowing with additional bags strewn across the pavement (the photo is from Google streetview to show approximate location but is very out of date) including broken glass. It's extremely difficult to push a wheelchair through as well as being dangerous with broken glass. There's also a tree that has been planted since the Google streetview image was taken which makes the pavement narrower for wheelchairs and pushchairs to get through.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Abbey Wood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing Street Litter Bins and Fly Tipping on Riverside Walk, 24th August
item.description:
The bins in this area are frequently not emptied in a timely manner, which has resulted in overflowing rubbish and subsequent fly tipping. This not only creates an unsightly environment but also attracts pests and poses health and safety concerns for residents and visitors who use the riverside walk. The situation undermines the appeal of what should be a clean and welcoming public space. I request that the Council takes urgent action to ensure bins are emptied regularly and that enforcement measures are taken to prevent further fly tipping. I would appreciate confirmation of the steps the Council will take to address this issue.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 20, Crane Street, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: England flags painted all over, 24th August
item.description:
England flags painted on the zebra crossing, on signs, on electricity boxes all around the area. Unfortunately this is a symbol associated with and a campaign supported by the far right and it is not something I want on my street in a diverse and inclusive community. I hope these will be removed as unlicensed graffiti, thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Charlton Lane, Charlton, London
Report on FixMyStreet
